conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from containers A, B, and C to determine which container (D or E) they will flow into.
Container A: The liquid falls perpendicularly downwards.
Container B: The liquid flows diagonally downwards to the right.
Container C: The liquid flows diagonally downwards to the left.
Container A: The liquid will flow directly into Container D since the baffle on the right side of A prevents the liquid from flowing further to the right.
Container B: The liquid will flow diagonally downwards to the right and will be diverted by the baffle to the right side, ultimately flowing into Container D.
Container C: The liquid will flow diagonally downwards to the left and will be diverted by the baffle to the left side, ultimately flowing into Container E.
Liquid from A will flow into Container D.
Liquid from B will also flow into Container D.
Liquid from C will flow into Container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into Container D. Liquid from C will flow into Container E.
